member.name: T:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasSpriteBatch
member.summary: Efficiently draws multiple bitmaps.

remarks.p:
CanvasSpriteBatch allows multiple bitmaps to be drawn more efficiently than would be possible by calling directly. CanvasSpriteBatch supports the following features:
Sprites can be drawn with their own position, scale, rotation and tint ( and
Individual sprites may be flipped horizontally or vertically. ()
Sprite Sheets ()
Sprites can be clamped to a source rectangle, removing the need to add padding between sprites in a sprite sheet.
Batches can be sorted by bitmap for better performance.

To use a sprite batch you first create a CanvasSpriteBatch from the CanvasDrawingSession using . Sprites can be added to the batch using and . When you have finished adding sprites call . At this point all sprites will be send to the drawing session.
The value of the drawing session's is checked once when the CanvasSpriteBatch is created. This is the unit mode that is used for all operations on the sprite batch.
The drawing session's affects all the sprites in the sprite batch at the point that is called.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasSpriteBatch.IsSupported(Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasDevice)
member.summary: Checks whether CanvasSpriteBatch is supported on the current operating system version.

remarks.p: If the application is currently running on an operating system that doesn't support sprite batch then calls to CreateSpriteBatch will fail.
If you know that your application will never run on an operating system that doesn't support sprite batch then there is no need to perform this check.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasSpriteOptions
member.summary: Options that apply to the entire spritebatch.

remarks.p: When drawing from a sprite sheet the GPU can sometimes sample from outside the source rectangle. Sprite sheets often need to have padding added between sprites to avoid this issue. When it is not possible or desirable to add this padding, the CanvasSpriteOptions.ClampToSourceRect option can be used instead. It adds a small performance cost to rendering, but ensures that nothing outside the source rect is drawn.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasSpriteOptions.None
member.summary: The default, no special options are provided.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasSpriteOptions.ClampToSourceRect
member.summary: Ensures that no pixels outside of the source rectangle get drawn.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasSpriteSortMode
member.summary: Controls how the sprites in a sprite batch are sorted.

remarks.p: The larger the batches that are sent to the graphics hardware the better the performance. Every time the bitmap changes a new batch must be started. If the sprites are sorted by bitmap then the batches can be larger. The downside to this if that if the code is relying on later sprites to draw over earlier sprites then this will break if the batches are sorted.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasSpriteSortMode.None
member.summary: No additional sorting is performed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasSpriteSortMode.Bitmap
member.summary: The sprites are sorted by bitmap, otherwise the order is preserved.
